pcask1d.src package¶

Submodules¶

pcask1d.src.density module¶

The file defines a particle density (probability distribution) and its various features/uses.

class pcask1d.src.density.Density¶

Bases: object

The class representing a particle density

norm()¶

pcask1d.src.fft module¶

Implements discrete Fourier transform over period params.cell in [-a,a] and frequencies defined by G = n*pi/a

class pcask1d.src.fft.Fourier(params)¶

Bases: object

Interface for switching between spaces for a given params

static fft(function_real)¶

Fourier transform: f(G) = (1/N) sum f(x) e^{2pi i G x}

static ifft(function_fourier)¶

Inverse Fourier transform

pcask1d.src.hamiltonian module¶

This file contains the Hamiltonian. Each Hamiltonian is defined for a given k-point and density, with methods to extract various quantities such as total energy, wavefunctions, and so on.

class pcask1d.src.hamiltonian.Hamiltonian(density, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

Class that implements the Hamiltonian object

eigendecomposition(params, num_states='all')¶

Calculate the num_states lowest lying eigenvectors and eigenvalues of the Hamiltonian

Parameters:

params (Parameters): input model for the system num_states (int): number of eigenvectors/eigenvalues to calculate

kinetic(params)¶

Kinetic operator in Fourier space: hat{T} = rac{1}{2} |G+k|^2

Parameters:

params (Parameters): input model for the system

representation(params)¶

Construct the representation (coefficients) of the Hamiltonian in the plane-wave basis

Parameters:

params (Parameters): input model for the system

total_energy(wavefunctions=None)¶

Total energy of a Hamiltonian

v_ext(params)¶

The non-local external potential operator: v_ext(G-G’) from mathcal{F}(v_ext(x))

Parameters:

params (Parameters): input model for the system

v_h(params)¶

The Hartree potential: v_h = rac{4 pi ho(G)}{|x-x'|})

Parameters:

params (Parameters): input model for the system

v_xc(params)¶

Exchange-correlation potential

Parameters:

params (Parameters): input model for the system

pcask1d.src.main module¶

pcask1d.src.main.main()¶

pcask1d.src.params module¶

Implements the parameters class, which carries the model (state) for the computation

class pcask1d.src.params.Parameters(**kwargs)¶

Bases: object

The use of this class is to generate a unique input (model) for a dft calculation. This includes parameters set by the user (e.g. scf_tol), and any derived quantities (e.g. num_planewaves).

The parameters object is designed to be immutable.

property cell¶
coulomb(charge: int, position: float) → numpy.ndarray¶

Returns the external potential of an ion with a given charge and position

property k_points¶

MP k-point grid within the first BZ: k in [-pi/a, pi/a]

property num_electrons¶

Number of electrons (counted s.t. charge neutrality is enforced)

property num_planewaves¶
property planewave_grid¶

Plane-wave frequences for plane-waves that fit in unit cell: G = 2pi n / R

property realspace_grid¶

Return real space grid for unit cell in Angstroms

property scf_history_length¶
property scf_step_length¶
property scf_tol¶
smearing_scheme(energy)¶

Ansatz for smearing the occupancies to prevent occupancy-induced instability in SCF iterations

property v_ext¶

External potential: either an atomic potential (Coulomb) or a given functional form

pcask1d.src.scf module¶

Class designed to keep and update the relevant state (e.g. density history) of a calculation en route toward self-consistency

class pcask1d.src.scf.SCF(params)¶

Bases: object

self stores state, namely, history of densities and residuals for quasi-Newton methods
